meanings.sent1: The staters in the meeting shared their opinions.

meanings.sent3: The staters at the debate club always had something to say.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency used in ancient Greece.
meanings.sent1: In ancient Greece, people traded goods for staters.
meanings.sent2: The merchant accepted both coins and staters as payment.
meanings.sent3: The archaeologist found a stash of old staters buried in the ruins.
meanings.sent4: The staters gleamed in the sunlight, showcasing their historical value.
meanings.sent5: The museum displayed a collection of ancient staters for visitors to see.

meanings.sent1: The stater in the office helped transcribe important documents.
meanings.sent2: The automated stater repeated the same message over and over.
meanings.sent3: The malfunctioning stater kept mispronouncing words, causing laughter.
meanings.sent4: The robotic stater hummed softly as it processed the information.
meanings.sent5: The high-tech stater efficiently converted speech into text.
